Identify the functional group of the following compound and predict its reaction with sodium hydroxide: 
CH3CH2CH2OH
message_2:
The given compound is CH3CH2CH2OH, which can also be written as C3H7OH. This compound contains an -OH group, which is an alcohol functional group.

When the alcohol reacts with sodium hydroxide (NaOH), it will undergo a reaction called acid-base reaction. In this reaction, the acidic hydrogen atom from the alcohol (-OH group) will be replaced by a sodium ion (Na+), forming a sodium alkoxide salt and water as a byproduct.

The reaction can be represented as follows:

C3H7OH + NaOH â†’ C3H7ONa + H2O

The product formed is sodium propoxide (C3H7ONa) and water (H2O).
